Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HRoffino
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at this hotel and it was horrible! The staff is rude and not helpful at all. Our room was old and dirty. They advertise that rooms are air conditioned, however, the main air conditioner is not turned on until later in the year so our room was hot. We couldn't sleep with the windows open because traffic noise is so loud. When we asked the manager about getting a fan or turning on the AC he basically told us there was nothing to do about it. We woke up to construction workers outside our room around 6am and loud house keepers opening and closing doors. The walls are very thin, we could hear the TV from next door. At breakfast they serve canned fruit. Definitely NOT a 4 star hotel!!! I'd say it barely gets a 1 star! Will never come back here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nytwind
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay at this hotel. It is in a fabulous location- a VERY short walk to the Termini and about 15 minutes to the Colosseum as well as there being lot of restaurants and shops in the immediate vicinity. The hotel personnel were wonderful, the breakfast was quite good and the free WiFi is always nice. The room was average and although the bathroom was large and spotless, there were a few "dust bunnies" under the furniture. Not a big deal as the room was basically pretty clean. They could have moved the extraneous chair out of the room as it was blocking access to the closet and had to be moved each time we wanted to use that side of the closet. Overall it was a comfortable stay except it was very hot in the room and the AC doesn't go on until May. As another reviewer said, if your room overlooks the four lane road which is jammed with trollies, buses and taxis going to the Termini, you're in for either an uncomfortably hot night or a very noisy one even on the 6th floor. I understand that the hotels are rated by various things like public areas, restaurants etc. which were quite nice but the room was not what i would consider a four star room. Overall not a bad place at all.

Reviews.Title: “The best stay ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: AniaHildrey
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Rome, having stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. We found it on Tripadvisor and it sounded pretty good. We were then slightly petrified when it went downhill in ratings with some comparing it to the Eastern European block type hotel. What a lot of nonsense!!! We need not have worried, as, having arrived, we were greeted by very polite and efficient concierge and reception staff. The check in was quick and we went to our room in a vintage style lift. We were given a fabulous room (standard double) with a double aspect windows and a nice sized balcony/terrace. The room was clean and a nice size, with lovely bathroom (great pressure and temperature control in the shower/bath). Tv in the room was the only 'ancient' element, as it was the old fashioned small screen massive thing taking half of the dressing table. But then again, we didn't go to Rome to watch tv, so... didn't matter that much. We did value unlimited wifi. You did have to ask for a ticket with the access code and each lasted 24hrs, but there was no limit as to how many slips you wanted at any one time, so we used 3 a day, as we had 3 devices. Breakfast was included and there was a lot more choice than we anticipated. Served from 7 until 10:30, it is very accommodating. Location is very good too: Termini (railway station) is literally 2-3min walk away; Colloseum, etc about 15-25 min walk; Vatican 30-45 min walk (or a short metro ride from Termini) and the shops and cafes are all around the place. If returning to Rome, we would stay there every time and opt for room 606! Top floor, great room and fabulous street view! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Michmosh
Reviews.Content: Had the best two nights in rome thanks to finding this hotel. Free wifi free printing, great roof top terrace amazing views of Rome. Hotel reception were the most helpful I have ever come across. Via Cavour if followed leads straight to the colosseum in around 15 mins. Fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Good place near termini”
Reviews.Author: Fairoz N Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the reception was very good, staff was very helpful and knew English . Breakfast was a good spread . Location is excellent, just 2 min walk from termini. The hotel is very nice, good lobby with neat dining area . The hotel is located in a old structure . The rooms are bit old but very clean and room service is great. The bathrooms are done up newly, clean with warm water and good facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Best long weekend away in Europe”
Reviews.Author: Purpleporsche
Reviews.Content: Location was ideal, only 10 mins away from the main Rome attractions. But quiet for when you want to sleep, although sirens seemed to be constant day and night. Bed and breakfast only as we wanted to dine somewhere different each evening. Breakfast was a selection of food from egg and bacon to continential. Lots of different restaurants close by of all prices. Service was excellent with the reception happy to make their recommendations. But Rome is expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: fitubolla
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Bettoja Atlantico hotel while on a business trip. The location next to the Termini train station is unbeatable, it's a really convenient location. (When arriving at the airport in Rome, don't pay for a taxi if you stay at this hotel, walk over to the airport train terminal, pay 14euro for a ticket in the Leonardo train (use a machine, the shops at the terminal take a fee). Remember to activate your ticket in the yellow stamping-machine or face a fine!). When you get off the train, you have ca 400metres to walk to get out of the front entrance of the station, and then ca 2 mins to walk to the hotel)). The hotel is nice but it shows a bit its age. Things work and are fine, but not very fancy or super-modern&practical. Depending on which room you get, you may find the noise from the street a bit disturbing (I was on the fourth floor, window facing the street but was not bothered by the noise). The breakfast is served in the adjacent hotel (easy access through a corridor), it is included in the room price. It was a disappointment to me actually. These was so much stuff, and somehow it was all a bit mehh. No problem to find stuff to fill your stomach up, but not very inspired breakfast. Internet was fast and worked well in the room. The staff was friendly and helpful, and even lent me an electric outlet adaptor when I realised I'd forgotten to bring one. The area around the train station may be slightly dodgy if you're out a bit late, but there is usually a lot of people around, so nothing to be very scared about. The area has lots of places to eat and drink. It's easy to walk down Cavour to the Coloseum/Forum Romanum/Palantine hill and onwards to the old centre (eg. Pantheon) . If you need the convenience of being near the train station, and need things to work (internet, etc), then this is the place for you. A bit too pricy, in my opinion, for what you get, but you know what you get.

Reviews.Title: “A throw back to eastern europe circa 1970”
Reviews.Author: Richard C
Reviews.Content: SLow, understaffed reception, wouldn't let us have a drink or even go in the virtually empty room bar bcause it was "reserved for dinners", breakfast was awful- bitte cafe, watery cold scrabmled eggs, warm organe squash, "ping" of lifts kept wasking us up. £85 a night they were haivng a laugh

Reviews.Title: “Great Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: CQRZ63011
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for five nights in April. It is about a five minute walk from the main train station, and it was easy to find. I wouldn't say the rooms are the most comfortable, but they are clean and large. It's right in the middle of the city so it's noisy, but that is what you get when you stay in the city. The breakfast in the morning was average too. They had assorted pastries, cereals, and fruit. It was enough to fill us up until lunch. I don't know if it was the time of year, but it was very crowded and hard to get a place to sit, even at 7am. Overall it is a great place to stay for the price and the location. It was within walking distance to the Colosseum, and close to public transportation, which made seeing Rome very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: whc23
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Atlantico is located a 10 minute walk from the railway station and within easy walking distance of the Forum and Colosseum. The room was very clean and comfortable. Hand and face towels were very thin, more like tea-towels. Bath towels were good. Hair-drier in bathroom. No iron or ironing board in the room. These are not even available on request at reception. The Hotel’s policy is to send clothes out for ironing, which will add to your budget. Free WiFi in the rooms, which was fast enough to stream video. Small TV is a bit far from the bed with very few channels in English. Small safe but not big enough for a standard size laptop. No clock/radio in the room, which was inconvenient when wanting to set a wake up alarm. You have to arrange a wake up call via reception. No tea or coffee making in the room and no complimentary service of these from reception. Comfortable bed with a firm mattress with an extra pillow available in the wardrobe. Clean, herringbone wooden floor with a few lose carpets. Marble floor in bathroom. Breakfast served 6:30-10:30 Dinner 7:00-10:30 Bar open from 10:00-24:00 Mini-bar prices Mineral water (500ml) €2.00 Orange Fanta, tonic water, coca-cola (all 330ml) €2.00 Beer (330ml) €3.00 Wine, white and red (250ml) €5.50 ¼ bottle dry Prosecco (200ml) €6.50 Congnac (50ml) €4.50 Whiskey (50ml) €4.50 Vodka (50ml) €3.50 Gin (50ml) €3.50 Peanuts (35g) €1.80 Chocolate (15g) €1.80 Laundry Prices Man’s shirt €4:00 Man’s trousers €4.50 Lady’s dress €9:00 Lady’s skirt €5:00

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the air con!”
Reviews.Author: ajb186338
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here before and like the location, the large, clean rooms and the breakfast. This trip was spoilt by the air conditioning being switched off. When we asked about it we were told to "open the window". As the room was directly above a four lane busy road and tram route the noise was incredible. So we had to decide - kept awake by very hot room (in late October) or kept awake by noise. They really do need to sort this out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: DavidH642
Reviews.Content: Hotel Atlantico is convienently located approx. 300 yards from the main rail station (an easy walk), just beside the easier to see Mediterranean Hotel. The rooms are pretty standard, clean and well organized. The cleaning staff are efficient and thorough. The elevator is small and 1920s style with exposed mechanics. The real treat here is the included breakfast...it was incredible...full breakfast with ample choice of eggs, bacon, cereal, and great coffee. A beautiful setting. A real good start to a day of sightseeing. The staff are friendly and helpful. A very good choice to start our Italy vacation

Reviews.Title: “Great, Quick stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Spiritgrl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 1 night after our cruise. We chose this hotel for the following reasons and it definitely met with our expectations: Close to Termini since we needed to get to Civitavecchia port, 4 star hotel with a very good promotional rate, free wi-fi, and good reviews. We were not looking to spend a fortune since it was only for one night, but wanted to be relaxed and comfortable. Our room was probably one of the largest that I have ever stayed in (in Europe) given their standards are slightly different than the US. Very spacious, very clean and though on a busy street I felt the noise was very limited. I must also promote the front desk service. We arrived 1 hour prior to check in and we were able to get our room. Upon arrival to our room, we were overcome with a thick, cigarette smoke smell inside. Everything else was fine, but given my husband's allergies we requested a room change. The front desk quickly accommodated our request and we were provided a new, smoke-free room. Only recommendation I have: The beds were quite hard. Not a big deal for a 1 night stay but I might think twice about a very long duration.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Stylish Art Decco Interior, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: CraigSunney
Reviews.Content: I used this hotel as a base more times than I can remember. Great location for arrival and departure from Termini Train station. Excellent service at the reception. At the top of Via Cavour & so walking distance from the colleseum or even the Spanish Steps (at a push), and yet the double glazing keeps out the street noise. Nice and cool too in the summer months. Neibour hotel Mediterraneo, has the highest rooftop bar balcony in Rome, perfect for chilling out after a day in Rome. Lots of ancillarary services (laundry, newspapers, bars etc) all around the area. All in all, a great hotel to know about if you visit Rome often.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at Best”
Reviews.Author: Shannon C
Reviews.Content: The daily breakfast was excellent and the rooms spacious for Europe, but if you need air conditioning don't stay here. The air conditioning was horrible in the rooms. After a day of touring Rome, we'd have to go to the lobby to cool down instead of our room. We would wake up hot in the middle of the night. Actually, the best a/c was in the foyer, but we couldn't sit or sleep there. Also, the internet was bogus. Even sitting near the wireless router in the lobby we could not sustain a solid connection. The front desk staff is rather impolite as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: RODRIG_CA
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel just a few steps from the on and off bus stop, and from the main train station in Rome: Roma Termini. The front desk guys are funny and friendly, and they have an AWESOME breakfast buffet included with your stay. I plan on staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great loction”
Reviews.Author: Wael S
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel just last week on my second night in Rome. This after getting the heck out of the Giglia d'opera hotel around the corner (I reviewed that one too). The staff was very helpful, Albert got us a great room at a good price. The hotel has free wifi and breakfast included. The room is big and comfi. So close from the termini station it is a great way to see rome by foot using the public transportation. Will stay there when back in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Sengoku
Reviews.Content: Very close to the main central station and pretty much all the main tourist attractions. This is the second time we've stayed here so we obviously like it!

Reviews.Title: “Was skeptical, but the hotel won me over.”
Reviews.Author: vacayanyday
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for almost a week. I didn't make the hotel arrangements, so I was a bit hesitant about the hotel and area in general. The hotel was in a convenient location. Across the street from the Termini station and as everyone says, walking distance to all the major sights such as the Colosseum, Trevi Fountan, Spanish Steps, Via Veneto, Bocca della Verita, etc. Keep in mind that walking to them will take you 20-30 depending on your speed. We opted to get to places via the hop on hop off bus which stops one block away from the hotel. The hotel is on a busy street, so if you are a light sleeper, ask for a room facing the rear. The hotel itself has old world charm. Not what a typical American hotel offers, but the room was clean, wooden floors were a nice change to see, bathroom seemed newly renovated, and housekeeping was great. Beds were firmer than expected, but we were so tired from sightseeing that it didn't really matter. The elevator was small and a bit slow, but didn't add or take away from our stay. Monica at the front desk was very accommodating and helpful. In general, the customer service wasn't as friendly as I had hoped, but this isn't a 5 star hotel. Breakfast was a pleasant surprise - great selection of foods and beverages, including espresso drinks. The waitstaff in the breakfast buffet area were incredibly nice and always had a smile even at the crack of dawn. WiFi was a bit of a hassle as one needed a new log-in and password each day. Connection could be weak at times. I was a bit skeptical about the area at night, but since it was still somewhat light out at 9:30 pm, there were plenty of tourists out and about and restaurants open in the neighborhood. I wouldn't recommend walking around the bus depot or Metro station, but the streets around the hotel were perfectly fine. The area might feel different in the winter. Tips: to those coming off the Leonardo Express Train at the Termini, When you get off the train, do not walk down the stairs marked exit, stay on street level and keep walking past all of the train tracks and exit through the main doors. If you exit down the stairs, you will come out at the back of the Termini which doesn't face the hotel's location on Via Cavour.

Reviews.Title: “This ws an ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: flufferton
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with a tour group, and this hotel was chosen for its position in relation to Rome Termini. Location was great as we needed to walk with luggage from the Termini to our hotel. Service was not so good as our room was not ready until 4:30. We were supposed to have a triple, and check-in time was 3:30 for this hotel. They were running behind and by the time we were given our room at 4:30, we found the air conditioning was not working. Temps were 100 degrees F outdoors so interior temps were also quite hot. When we complained however, they moved us to a new room pretty quickly, we just did not understand why they did not put us in a working room from the start. The rooms we were in were pretty outdated as to style--old carpeting in the one and old area rugs in the other. As long as the air worked though, we were ok. Breakfast was so-so continental with scrambled eggs and under-cooked bacon. We however found this type of breakfast to be pretty common at the hotels we stayed at throughout our stay in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “It was good”
Reviews.Author: Kelleegirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very close to the Termini, but not the end that you get on the train to the airport. The hotel was nice and very clean. It was a bit noisy at night, but we were so exhausted from sight seeing that it didn't really matter. The front desk staff was very nice and helpful. We walked to almost every major attraction including the Trevi fountain, the Spanish steps, and the colosseum. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: ovk2013
Reviews.Content: It is quiet nice hotel- a little bit old and shabby, but clean. The rooms are clean enough. But the best advantage that it is close to the raiiway station-only 200 metres. But it is noisy in the night and late in the morning. The hotel stands on the principal street and a lot of traffic around.

Reviews.Title: “Good option in Rome”
Reviews.Author: dvisser83
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is pretty good on arrival to Rome from the Leonardo De Vinci airport (which by the way is also called Fiumicino just to confuse tourists I think). It links up with the subway and tram lines as well. The only problem with the subway when we were there is that is closed down at 9pm due to construction, so it very much limited how far and late you could be out unless you wanted to get creative about getting back to the termini area. This is no fault of the hotel, but takes it's value down a bit for using it as a flexible hub. Walking to the Colluseum was 10-15 minutes and the Pantheon/Trivi fountain was about 20. Ok if you have the time but there really isn't a lot going on in that route so it gets a little old the 2nd or 3rd time. Also, we heard rumors about seedy people being next to the train station but I never thought twice about walking around the hotel at night, it was really no issue. The hotel itself was good. It felt like 3-star rooms, but all clean and no complaints. The rooftop bar provides a great view of the skyline so take advantage of that. Breakfast was really good. It had some hot items, like delcious bacon, that you don't find in a lot of European breakfasts. Internet was a little strange. It was free, but we had to ask for a new password every 24 hours. Kind of annoying because the last morning it wasn't worth it to go down and ask, but it would have been nice to use. We would probably stay here again if we got a good deal, however we will look first if we can find a room near the Pantheon area as that seemed to be the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, mostly good staff, terrible bed, no AC”
Reviews.Author: ISJP2012
Reviews.Content: The location for the hotel can’t be beaten in our opinion. With the termini station so close you are well positioned to get around the city conveniently. The staff on the front desk and concierge were very polite and helpful. They endeavoured to fulfil anything we asked of them. The housekeeping was excellent. The room was very clean, towels etc changed every day. The staff in the breakfast room were very poor and didn’t provide any service to the guests. They were very slow to clean tables, began removing food from 10 - even though breakfast is meant to run until 10.30 and would promptly lock the door at that time; trapping guests still finishing breakfast. Although there was a variety of food at breakfast, we found the meagre 'hot' food to be anything but. On several days there were many lacking items such as bread for toast (a staple!) mugs for coffee, or cutlery. Our experience at breakfast did not encourage us to investigate the hotel restaurant. The bed and pillows were ROCK HARD and we are used to a firm bed, but we were unable to sleep. When we complained the front desk response was great - offered to change our room (we were told this was one of some brand new beds). In the end housekeeping were able to add a foam topper, making it more comfortable. The AC in the room wasn’t providing any form of cooling. We asked the reception and were told the plumber is looking into it - will be working in 20mins, but nothing changed. As it was warm we had to open the windows making it very noisy - midsummer the heat would be unbearable as the sun hits the room in the morning. They provide free Wi-Fi internet, however the connection is very poor and totally unreliable. Overall the hotel did the job of providing a good location to explore from. It didn’t bring our trip down, but it definately didn’t add anything.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough hotel good location if you want to be close to the termini”
Reviews.Author: Reinhardt416
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights in October. The staff were nice and spoke little english. The room was small but it did have a safe to lock up our valuables. The best part of this stay was it was within walking distance to the ancient ruins and the train station. I would take a taxi from the airport to get here because we took a shuttle, thinkng we were saving money, but it took forever as our hotel was the LAST stop. Do NOT rent a car in Rome! Walk, take a taxi, rent a bike whatever to get around, but do NOT drive in this crazy city! Rome was awesome. I would stay at this hotel again, the price and service and location were great. Just don't expect a 4 or 5 diamond room.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned hotel close to Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: psandps
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here. Hotel is not a typical multi-national 4* but has character and is located in heart of city, close to the Termini station. My room was spacious and furnished in 30's style with parquet floors and a basic but clean bathroom. Breakfast was typical Southern European buffet and served in a old, sea themed dining room which is shared with the adjacent Meditteraneo hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A True Roman Stay”
Reviews.Author: dlrvdth
Reviews.Content: Everything that most people hated about this hotel made it a true Roman stay for us. Our room opened on to the street and it was busy and noisy. It was centrally located and right down the street from the main train station. Some people said that it was not a 4 Star. Maybe it wasn't by "other" standards, but it was by Roman standards. WE LOVED IT. We did EVERYTHING on foot from this location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: baileysjr
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and very nice sized rooms by European standards but for those of you that are thinking you are going to a resort, you will be disappointed. We loved it but we didn't go to Rome to see a hotel. That said, we were very comfortable here. It is so close to the Termini station that you have no trouble starting your walking vacation immediately. There is air conditioning (a must for Italy), room safe, small frig (really an overpriced mini bar but you can stash your own water during your stay) and a much larger breakfast than average. You are just not going to find free internet much in Europe much less gyms/pools - this is not a big American chain but again we didn't come to Rome to swim, surf the net and workout! The lift is the original one from the 1930s and the furniture is all real wood pieces from that era as well. We enjoyed the art deco look. Great bathroom! Hotel restaurant was well out of our price range but you are in the middle of downtown Rome with all kinds of options. We did not use our "balcony" - little table and chairs on the tiniest balcony ever. We crawled out there to see it but honestly you are going to eat outside at a little table in the street dining in Rome anyway - not much point to doing that in your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel We Stayed at in Italy”
Reviews.Author: MarcTheo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. Everything that we needed, we had. The location was PERFECT! In 2 minutes you would find yourself at the Termini, which is exactly where you want to be! The people were very friendly (save the overnight gentleman). Especially Albert at the desk! He did EVERYTHING for us, with a smile on his face. From booking taxis, to booking restaurants, to calling AirFrance for us, he is very good for this hotel. The room was gorgeous, and the bathroom was spacious, and had a basket FILLED with soaps and shower caps and shampoos! We didnt even use all that was given on the first day! There is a stocked minibar, and the beds are quite comfortable! Breakfast was AMAZING! There is a little bit of something for everyone! Lots of pastries, and eggs and cooked meats and yogurts, and juices and coffee...you name it! Because of the location, and helpfulness of the staff, I DEFINITELY recommend this hotel! It is well worth the extra price!

Reviews.Title: “Very close to train station”
Reviews.Author: cervelo_rs
Reviews.Content: A reasonable hotel, very close to the train station. We were greeted by a very pleasant front desk assistant who spoke excellent English. The first room allocated had 2 single beds, but the hotel were happy to change us to a double bedded room. It was comfortable and more than adequate. The room faced the rear and were glad to be able to open a window for some fresh air without the traffic noise. The furniture is dated, but in good condition and it gives the hotel a pleasant old fashioned feel to it. The bed was comfortable and we had a good nights sleep. The location was excellent, we arrived and left by train and were able to explore the area around the Colliseum as it was a shortish walk. In the morning, breakfast was much better than you typically find in Italian hotels; wide choice and replenished throughout. The hotel was perhaps a little expensive, but Rome is pricey and there are few 'good deals' in the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Rlblack
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in the morning. There were 4 of us- 2 rooms, one room was ready other was not- the staff were very accommodating. When other room was ready (within 1.2 hr.) they moved the luggage. Very clean and centrally located. Staff was very good with directions, information on area, and went out of thier way to make our visit special. The "continental breakfast"- was a good meal with hot eggs and breakfast meat, cereals, fruit, breads, and a great "cappuccino machine. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: LorrieG
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in august 2010. THE ROOM : Spacious with plenty wardrobe room. Comfy beds. Lovely bathroom. Has all the essentials. Can be noisy at night though as Rome is a busy city. THE STAFF: the staff were very helpful. They gave us maps and indications on were to go. Also our bags were brought up to our room for us. THE FOOD: Breakfast is served in the sister hotel attached to the atlantico. There is a wide variety of foods so there is something for everyone. THE AREA; less than a five minute walk from the train station. DO NOT BE TRICKED INTO GETTING A TAXI TO THE HOTEL... its so close to the trainstation. Situated in the middle of many great attractions/ sights to see. Tour buses run from around the corner of the hotel. OVERALL: Great place to stay as it is litrally in the middle of everything in rome. The only snag i had with the place is that the bar was closed but it may be open now. Otherwise i would really recommend it. Great location, rooms, food and staff, what more do you want?

Reviews.Title: “Had a fabulous time and they staff were great!!”
Reviews.Author: alison737
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 week at the hotel and found that the staff especially the front desk were great. No big language barriers and very helpful when inquiring about restaurants/transportation and general questions. Hotel is very close to the train/bus station (5 minutes) which made transportation for Rome very easy. Also the hot breakfast was wonderful....lots of variety.. I would return to this Hotel next trip. The room was very clean and comfortable. So busy on our trip we never checked out any of the amenties in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great find - would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: stu6278
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on Via Cavour and is very convenient for Termini Station or the Coach drop-offs from Fiumicino/Campino and also the Colisseum. Staff were friendly and courteous and spoke good English. The room we stayed in was clean and well decorated. It had high-ceilings, large windows and loads of storage space - which is always a plus if you're staying somewhere for longer than a couple of days. As others have mentioned, this is a hotel that has maintained much of the Art Deco style and looks very classy. The room was quiet at night but we were overlooking a side-street so some of the other rooms facing the main road may have been different. Breakfast was typical continental fare with eggs and bacon but there was a good choice, breads, cheese, cooked meats, yogurt etc. all served in a lovely large room in the adjacent hotel done out with mermaids and matching lanterns! Although I say adjacent hotel, it's directly attached and you really don't realise you're entering a different place. Would definitely return when we go to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: JimZurich_Canada
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Atlantico for 3 days. Had a marvellous experience. 100 yards from Termini and all transportation hubs. Rooms were spacious and clean. Continental breakfast was superb. Offered everything you could want for breakfast. Staff spoke English fluently, were polite and very helpful. Rorberto, the concierge very knowledgble and helpful. Next visit to Rome would definitely stay at Atlantico.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: PunitMalhotra
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right next to the main train station in Rome, the Termini station. This makes it very convenient to travel within italy as well for tours within Rome. Many monuments such as the Colloseum are a 8-10 min walk. Rooms are smallish but clean. Staff is helfpul. The hotel is adjoining another, more expensive Bettoja Hotel property, the Mediterraneo and these two hotels share some ameneties such as breakfast room, business centre. The Breakfast could have better, there were not as many choices aswe had expected. Mediterraneo has a greatroof to restaurant which is worth a visit. Overall, our stay was good and i would recomend this to fellow travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ronni68
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so close to everything we walked everywhere. The staff were more friendly than we were led to believe Italians were, but still it was just acknowledgement, not engagement. We hit Rome when the heat wave hit - it was 39 degrees with 85% humidity and we could not get cool, The aircon was barely adequate and we slept terribly as a result. The breakfast room was cramped and a little dark, but the food was fine. I question it's 4 star rating, perhaps more a 3, but from what I hear, that appears to be standard in Europe. I would try another hotel in future, this wasn't a spectacular visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: ClareBride2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in April of 2009 with friends. I have to say the location was great, we walked to all the sites. We flew into Rome airport and took the train right into the city of Rome. From there it was about two blocks to the hotel. The rooms were a good size. Beds were not too comfortable. It did get a bit loud at night because of the city traffic. The breakfast was decent too. I would suggest getting there very early... we arrived at around 7:30 am and could not find a place to sit. I would definitely suggest staying here if you are in Rome for a night or two and are looking to get all of the sites in and not break your wallet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely old hotel”
Reviews.Author: writesabit
Reviews.Content: A lovely old hotel within very close walking distance to the main train station. We flew into Rome, took the express train to the main station and walked a block to the hotel. This was our first trip to Rome, booked this entire leg on our own, and it worked out wonderfully. The hotel is neat as a pin, the staff were very helpful and the included breakfast was more than ample. A 15 minute walk to the Colosseum, an easy subway ride to just about anywhere else. The area is safe, lots of people out and about and there are many restaurants and shops. I was a little nervous with all of the warnings about pickpockets etc. but we had no trouble at all. People were very helpful. Don't be afraid, just be aware.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, great location, convenient and better than most European hotels”
Reviews.Author: sweetgirlmom
Reviews.Content: I traveled to this hotel with my husband and 6 yr old daughter, and it was our first time in Rome, so we did not know very well where to stay, etc. We had read that the area around the Termini station was not a very good one, but we chose the area because of the convenience to the train station, and we specifically chose Bettoja because it appeared to be on a busy, main road (and therefore safe). The location turned out to be great- very convenient, easy walk to the Roman forum and Colosseum; also, because it was on a busy road, with lots of little cafes and shops, it felt very safe, even walking back at night. One downside to the busy road, was that there is significant noise from the street at night, but with the windows closed, it wasn't too bad. The room - we got a corner room, probably because we asked for a cot for our daughter, and the corner rooms are probably bigger; the size was very good for European standards, and there was even an in-room safe, and hair dryer (no iron though). the room was very clean, and well serviced daily by the maid service. Breakfast was included with the hotel charge, and it was also quite good, again compared to what we had expected in Europe; there was a few warm items as well as a varied assortment of breads, croissants, spreads, cereal, cheese and yogurt; there was also a self-serve cappuccino machine. The staff was very friendly and courteous. even in the breakfast area, if there was a shortage of something, they were well staffed and promptly assisted for any requests.

Reviews.Title: “More then I expected!”
Reviews.Author: Waterman88
Reviews.Content: Beautiful little hotel. Nice lobby with friendly staff who smiled and greeted each and every one of the 30 members of our tour group every time we entered or exited the hotel. The rooms are large, clean, have big windows, hardwood floors, and lots of hot water for the nice bathrooms. Breakfast was large, and offered pastries, fresh juices and coffee, fruit, and much more. Also, the location doesn't get any better!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and helpful staff. As close to train station as you can get”
Reviews.Author: LiveTaTravelOz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Atlantico Hotel in Rome for 3 nights in Feb 2010 with my husband and our 2 yo. Firstly, its a stones throw from the Termini Station so your in luck if your coming or going by train. We got a taxi from the airport to the hotel - it took us 10-15 mins. The staff were helpful upon arrival and made us a booking at the restaurant located at the adjoining sister hotel, the Mediterraneo where we enjoyed a lovely 3 course meal which couldnt be faulted. All the staff speak english very well and were understanding of our basic italian. At dinner at the restaurant they were very helpful when my toddler was less than agreeable. The room had 3 single beds - a bit depressing for my husband and I but I believe this is quite common in Europe. Our room was a corner room overlooking two streets and the only downside to this was the traffic noise early in the morning - Italians do a lot of honking when the traffic flow doesn't suit them. However we could open all the windows were to let in lots of fresh air at night and it was a lot quieter in the evenings, The TV had a few english speaking channels which was a good bonus. The room was very spacious - and had a lot of storage places - coat racks, large dresser, large wardrobe, lots of walking around room which is rare in European hotels. The bathroom was made of nice marble and the water pressure fantastic. The first day we were there we walked to the Colosseum which was about 1.7 km, mostly downhill too which was good when your pushing a stroller. Also, we were about a 5 minute taxi ride to the Vatican city. This hotel was great value due to its proximity to public transport, tourist locations, and the size of the room itself was a good suprise too. The hotel is very close to a laundromat if you have a ton of washing and don't want to pay the inflated and ridiculous hotel price. It is also very very close to a lot of delis which sell great cheese/wine/meats if you feel like a quiet relaxing snack after a big day of sightseeing. Great staff, fantastic location, spacious rooms and elegant bathroom. I would stay in this hotel again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: GinnieMauritius
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to Termini Station. The furniture in the room were old but clean and the bathroom was not very nice, old taps and hard to open. When someone from a room next door was taking a shower it was very noisy and many times this woke us up early in the morning. The breakfast was nice, the staff was helpful. The view and the food from the open roof restaurant next door was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good 4* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nevm
Reviews.Content: Good 4 star hotel. Good location; hotel food was good, though pricey and not difficult to fine better priced quality restaurants in the vicinity. We had to change our room and the matter was dealt with, most commendably; very helpful staff. Hotel is old and so everything from the lift etc is quite ancient and creaking. If I recommended anyone to stay here I would suggest that they should insist for a room on the first two floors only.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: MoneshB
Reviews.Content: Very Close to the station. Good comfortable rooms. Excellent breakfast. Easily accessable. Quaint old decor.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Atlantico”
Reviews.Author: MustangJoe
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked a package that included air-fare, transfers and 7 nights at the Atlantico. We checked the ratings on TA and decided to give it a try. We were not disappointed. This is a very nice hotel and I can't think of anything bad to say about it. We were up on the 5th floor at the back away from the street so we never had any issues with noise. The included breakfast was good and the capuccino was excellent. The rooms were clean and well maintained. The room includes a safe but not an alarm clock. Bring your own battery powered one or use the wake-up call service. The power outlets in the room turn off when you remove your card to leave so any devices that are plugged in will shut off. The A/C was quiet and unobtrusive. We took advantage of the rooftop terrace at night to enjoy a prosecco, enjoy the view and discuss our day of site-seeing. The terrace is in the attached Mediterraneo hotel, along with the breakfast buffet. I've read some posts that claim that the area around Termini isn't so nice but that doesn't seem to be the case with Via Cavour, west of Termini where the Atlantico is located. We never felt unsafe while walking around, day or night. I would definitely return to the Atlantico if given the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: EdmontonTeachergirl
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel mainly based on price and location. The hotel is two blocks from Termini train station, which has access to metros, trains (including a direct Leonardo train to Fiumicino airport) and buses. The hotel is a 10 minute walk to the Colosseum, Forum, Palatine Hill, Capitol Hill and Piazza Reppublica, and about a 20 minute walk to the Spanish Steps. Our room faced the street so there was some street noise at night, but otherwise the hotel was very quiet. The air conditioning (essential in Rome in August) was good, and very quiet. The rooms have full bathrooms (if you've traveled in Europe, you know what I mean!) with big bathtubs, nice sinks and bidets. The otel staff is wonderful, we dealt primarily with Albert, and he was very helpful. He and the other staff helped us book tours and reserve tickets to the Galleria Borghese (reservations are REQUIRED for this museum), and called us taxis multiple times. The continental breakfast has lots of variety, including hot and cold items (not just toast and fruit), and the breakfast staff is very organized. The rooms were always cleaned perfectly. The hotel does offer room service (although we didn't try it) and there is pay-per-use internet (takes credit cards) in the connected Mediterraneo Hotel. The rooftop restaurant and garden in the connecting hotel is expensive, but if you only go for a drink and dessert it's not bad, and it has a great view of the city at night. Overall, this a lovely hotel in a great location, and I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oceanlover2902
Reviews.Content: While Bettoja Atlantico has some pluses it definitely does not deserve a or come close to a 4 star rating, even by European standards. The rooms are clean and large, but nothing about this property is luxurious. Moreover, while the front desk staff (there is no concierge) will answer your questions, they offer little more. Lastly, the buffet at a Comfort Inn in the U.S. is better than this “full, European buffet breakfast”. On the plus side, the hotel is well located given its 2 block walk to the Termini station and .5 mile walk to the Coliseum. The neighborhood is safe, which makes you comfortable walking either day or night, and offers a few shops and restaurants. If you want a true 4 star hotel, definitely look elsewhere. I stayed at 2 different 4 star hotels in Germany last March and they were far, far superior to the Bettoja Atlantico. I got the hotel for $115 (U.S. dollars) per night through a Priceline bid and feel I did “okay” believing I got a clear cut example of “you get what you pay for”. In summary, it was a “fine” experience, but I would never stay there again or recommend it to anyone I know, especially if they want a 4 star hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “When visiting Rome, this is the place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: spillersm
Reviews.Content: If you going to visit Rome, this is where you want to stay. First, it's only about two small blocks (five minute walk) from the main train station. Since buses and trains leave from the station, you have transportation to anywhere in the city you wish to go. Also, hop on and hop off tour buses leave from the train station. But if you like to walk, it's only about a 15 minute walk from the hotel to the Coloseum and the National Monument. The hotel rooms are very clean and remained clean during our 4 night stay. Prices were reasonable. The breakfast was included with the price and had eggs, ham, bacon, pasterys, yogurt, fresh mozzerella cheese and several other items. This gives you an example of how good the breakfast was. We stayes right by the street, and the noise wasn't noticable from our room. I'm a pretty light sleeper, so this is important. The staff is extremely helpful. Albert, the desk clerk, was sure we knew the times the attractions and museums were open and closed, what resturauntes were open and confirmed our ride to the airport. The air conditioning was a relief in the heat.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to all sites by foot, subway or train.”
Reviews.Author: Veronika001
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8 days with a 14 year old teen age boy.. The hotel rooms are dated, but spacious and VERY CLEAN. Continental breakfast with a nice variety. Staff was very helpful and accomodating. We like to walk it is centraly located for easy access to all sites. Subway and the train station are less than 5 minutes walk. We took several day trips by train to Pompeii, and Naples, also 3 days 2 nights to Venezia. Many restaurants too choose from. Large grocery store near by, help cutting food and drink costs. If I have a chance to return to Rome, I certainly would stay here again. Veronika Bakersfield, Ca.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and no frills”
Reviews.Author: mea98pkl
Reviews.Content: Well located walking distance from the main Terminus train station. Pretty much no-frills, the hotel is not the newest in Rome, but the rooms are clean and the staff are polite. The rooftop restaurant in its sister hotel next door is a little gem with a great view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: damien
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel from June 15 - 22. I have never met such helpful front desk staff in my life and I travel a lot. Alberto and Stephano helped us daily by drawing us maps and suggesting places for us to go. There was also another lady who normally works in the sister hotel who was very helpful. We had a corner room 506 which was large with 2 arm chairs. The only drawback was that the only TV channel was CNN which was not available after the first 2 days. The breakfast was very good with excellent Orange juice. Most of the touristy sites were within walking distance. The train station and the metro were only a 5 minute walk away. We did a day trip to Orvietto which I would recommend and also to Frascatti. We went to an Opera "La Traviata" in an old church. Also a Vavaldi concert in the same place. The Borghese Gallery should not be missed. There were many restaurants within easy walking distance of the hotel. Our favourite was "Bella Roma" which was very close to the hotel. We would certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This was a nice room, spacious, but loud”
Reviews.Author: barryfcas
Reviews.Content: We had a three night stay here in July, which was booked via Priceline. So we didn't really pick it, but requested a 4 star or better hotel for $145 per night. I think it was a decent value for the price we paid. The rooms are large and air conditioned and nicely furnished. There's a refrigerator minibar in the room that we used to refrigerate our drinks. I am glad that we'd read the reviews on this site, so we knew to ask for a quiet room (away from Via Cavour). As it was, it was pretty noisy anyway. They were doing street construction one night with a jackhammer until 1 a.m. The horns and birds were pretty noisy as well in the morning. There is wireless internet available, but it was very expensive. I think four days of broadband would have cost us around 80 euros, if I remember correctly. We decided to go to the internet cafe around the corner for 4 euros per hour. The breakfast room is in the adjacent sister Hotel Mediterraean. It is large and well furnished. The staff were helpful and made inquiry for us to get a reservation at the Borgese Gallery. The location is very convenient to the Termini station for connections to anywhere, but is a little ways from most of the attractions. In summary, I wouldn't pay full fare for this hotel, but via Priceline, it was a good value for us.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel; Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelGalRed
Reviews.Content: Does anyone who has rated this hotel 5/5 know what a truly Excellent hotel is like? Using words like "acceptable" and "okay" when supporting a 5-star rating is contradictory. In any case, our brief stay was exactly what we were looking for at the price point we wanted. Extremely convenient to the train station. Surprisingly quiet room, even facing the street. Clean, but dated, rooms. Breakfast had a wide variety, but the quality of the food paled in comparison to our other Italian hotel stays. All in all, I would consider this a prefectly fine budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bellissimo!”
Reviews.Author: ny2pa
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice hotel to stay at and also at a great location near Termini Station - then Hotel Bettoja Atlantico is the place to stay. I must admit when our travel agent suggested this hotel I was a little skeptical and started checking Trip Advisor for any reviews. Trip Advisor is a good guideline for information and reviews but everyone has different standards and only you can make your own decision. As soon as you walk through their doors you are greeted with a big smile and “Buongiorno!” They served a complimentary breakfast and also have a roof top terrace in the adjoining hotel Mediterrano. Our room was very clean and was perfect for our 9-night stay. The front desk is so very helpful. For us, they arranged transfers to & from the airport, they helped in planning tours, suggested great restaurants to eat and even called ahead for us, helped us daily on taking their buses and train systems to various sights. Alberto, Gianluca, Monica, Roberto, Giovanni, Stefano and the entire staff were very helpful and made our stay wonderful and most memorable. We would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again! Thank you all for your kindness and all your help. M.Schultheis

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: BigDenLeiden
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the Atlantico. Incredible staff...friendly,competent and most helpful. Ideally located with plenty of shopping and fine restaurants nearby. The rooms were quite large and well equipped. Breakfast was wonderful and the hotel's rooftop restaurant has a fabulous view of Rome. Only drawback was that we tried three different roofs and could not find beds that were comfortable.....extremely hard Look into the hotel's website for special promotions. Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room in good location”
Reviews.Author: S-ALK-74
Reviews.Content: After using Priceline to book a 4-star hotel in the city centre we were a bit disappointed when we read the reviews for this hotel. However, upon arrival we were pleasantly surprised. Yes, the hotel can be noisy but we live in London and are used to traffic. It's just background noise and if you ask for a room on the backside of the hotel noise is not a problem. The location was also great - very conveniently located to the terminal so we could just walk to and from the Leonardo Express train to the airport. We were also able to be on the buses or metro within minutes. Although there are no sights of interest to see in the Termini area (it's mainly hotels and restaurants) the location is still quite central and other main areas of interest are just a few metro stops away. The rooms were clean, the beds were relatively comfortable and the bathrooms seemed like they had been newly renovated. We had a corner room which was very spacious. The only downside was that we had asked for a king sized bed and ended up with two singles, which we pushed together. We had arrived late at night and didn't feel like moving rooms but the next day the hotel offered us the chance to switch. However, we decided we liked the extra space in the corner room so we stayed. Breakfast was great and hotel staff working in the day were very helpful (staff working late at night were not so helpful). The price was very reasonable for a hotel in the city center of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this so-called 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ritochka
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not in a good area of the city, but in the center, & very close to the train & bus stations. It's convenient & close to all Rome attractions. Hotel is situated on a busy street & rooms facing this street are very noisy. Rooms are so run down, old & dusty. Tasteless, basic decoration. Cheap furniture, bedding & bathrooms. Breakfast is very basic with limited selection. Waitresses do not speak and understand English. Pictures of the rooms are misleading. Front desk staff was friendly & spoke good English. Very interesting interior of the restaurant which belongs to the sister hotel and where they serve breakfast for 2 hotels. If you complain they will change a room for a bigger size.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and hotel but pack earplugs! Way too noisy outside.”
Reviews.Author: ClarkWGriswald
Reviews.Content: My wife and I pricelined this hotel for $110 dollars. We thought by getting a 4 star in a good location, we couldn’t lose. We did. While the hotel is clean, has a large room and bathroom, and is situated in a great spot (close to the train station), it is incredibly noisy. The street below is very loud and it feels like every noise just comes right into the room. Sirens, car horns, cars hitting potholes, etc. Expect to hear it all! Bring some sleeping medicine and your noise-cancelling headphones. You will need it if you stay in room #209. Thank goodness we were there for only one night. The next day we were on a train and were able to catch-up on our sleep. What a disaster. (I should add that my we are in our thirties and have traveled Europe extensively. We have grown to expect/accept more traffic noise than at home. This hotel, however, was too noisy.)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel , great location”
Reviews.Author: LoopyStimlin
Reviews.Content: Strangely I booked to stay at a different hotel, however for reasons which are still not clear to me my reservation was changed to the Hotel Atlantico. I couldn't be happier about this! The hotel is in a perfect location right next to Termini. Thus you have access to the Metro, buses and open top tour buses as well as being able to walk to all major attractions. The Metro in Rome will not take you into the Centro Storico but buses do. Reception will tell you the numbers you need. We found them very easy to use and useful, as at 6.5 months pregnant I wasn't keen on walking far. Breakfast at this hotel was great - a good choice; fruit, yogurt, cereals, bread and pastry products, eggs, cheese, ham, and a couple of cooked items. Amazingly they also do a good cup of tea (how British am I?)! The staff on reception and the porters were extremely helpful and friendly. The only slight downside was that we had a room facing onto the street and there was traffic noise. Take ear-plugs or ask for a room at the back. We loved the Art Deco decoration! Also - you need to be aware that you are staying in Rome and therefore you will be paying more for a hotel than other European cities. Accept this and enjoy yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: ZoriMiami_Florida
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this hotel for three nights and we had a great experience. The room was very clean and big!! The concierge staff was friendly and helpful. We had breakfast included and it was very good since eating in Rome can be a little pricey. This hotel is closed to the Termini Station which was very convenient. When we landed at the airport we took the Leonardo Exress to Termini Station. The hotel is just minutes away from the station so you can walk to the hotel. Keep in mind that taking the Leonardo Express can be dissapointing since it did not have air condition and it was packed with people. While in Rome we had the great experience of contacting Angelo Di Mauro which was an excellent tour guide!! He took us to Civitaveccia to take our cruise. When we came back, he picked us up and took us to Pisa and then to Florence where we stayed for five nights. Angelo is fluent in English as well as Spanish which was convenient for us!! I will definetely stay at this hotel again and I will definetely call Angelo so he can take us everywhere!!! You may contact Angelo at [---]. Arrivederci!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chris7250
Reviews.Content: During our recent trip to Italy, we used Rome as a stop-over between tours. During our first and second stops in Rome, we stayed at the Atlantico and were very satisfied. We were a party of three, so we had a nice-sized triple room. It was room with two double beds and they included a single "roll-away" type bed. The desk agent was waiting for us when we arrived each time. The room was clean, the beds were comfortable and the location was excellent, being close to Termini, which is where the two Rome metro lines intersect. The staff was very helpful and friendly, making dinner reservations for us, etc. They also allowed us to keep a few pieces of luggage at the hotel between stops so we would not have to pack everything with us the whole time. While Atlantico is not what I would consider a "destination" type hotel, we had not planned on and did not spend a lot of time there. We were in Rome and tried to take as much of it in as possible. Atlantico and her staff were there when we needed them and we had a delightful stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Their website is also helpful and includes some suggested Itineraries. On the whole, we were very satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Never Ever Again”
Reviews.Author: DanGro
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel in Europe. Very noisy hotel. Breakfast not good. Backrooms has view on "rubbishdump".

Reviews.Title: “Exactly What was Promised”
Reviews.Author: USALuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel close to the train station with a super knowledgable staff and the best breakfast of any hotel we stayed in on this trip. The rooms were standard European size with hard beds but that seems to be the norm. A little noisy at night but that's Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: J2G
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews on this website. The location was great , less than a block from the Termini which is the main train/bus/metro terminal. It may it very easy for us to get to and back from Rome's attractions and if we walked to them, we were able to take the bus back to the hotel as many of the buses end at the termini. We were pleased with the overall look of the hotel, nice reception area, nice breakfast room, small elevator but it works well. Our room was large enough for a queen size bed, a small seating area in front of the TV, a desk, a built in closet and chest of drawers. Ceilings were high which was nice. There is a small refrigerator/mini bar in the room where you can keep your own food and water. The room, specially the carpet, looks a little worn but it was clean. The bathroom was all marble and kept clean, tub is high, may not be adequate for people that have difficulty climbing over a barrier. The breakfast had scrambled and boiled eggs, bacon, assortment of breads, yogurt, fruit, cereal, coffee...enough to have a good breakfast that tied you over till a late lunch. The staff was very nice and helpful, they all spoke English and some spoke Spanish. The only things we wish we had was an alarm clock, softer towels, softer toilet paper, an iron and ironing board, better TV options and free internet, they had an internet connection but you had to pay for it. Overall it was great and convenient hotel for our wonderful trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: rejrej
Reviews.Content: I was very sceptical when we first arrived due to the bad reviews but I have to say that it wasn't that bad at all, I would call it a 4 minus star hotel due to the old furnitures but it was very clean and large enough. The breakfast was good and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The only bad thing about the hotel was the soundlevel due to it's location. You could hear the traffic from the street 24/7, other then that it was really nice and I would definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal!”
Reviews.Author: DCDolcevita
Reviews.Content: It’s hard to find any hotels for under 200 euros a night in Rome, and most of the ones you can get in that price range are positively squalid. Hotel Atlantico is an exception – for the 165 euros we paid, we got a very large, clean, nicely furnished room with all the amenities, including a bathtub, stocked mini-bar, safe and hairdryer. The breakfast buffet, located inside the adjoining Hotel Mediterraneo, was good, with various breads, cheeses, meats, yogurt, fruit, eggs and bacon. The internet in the lobby was broken while we were there, but we could use the one in Hotel Mediterraneo, and there are several internet points nearby. The hotel is well-located, just two short blocks from the train station, close to metro and buses, a walkable distance to the Colosseum and Forum. There aren’t a lot of good restaurants or nightlife in this neighborhood, which is somewhat on the seedy side, and because the hotel is on a major street the noise level can be quite loud with the windows open. But in comparison to other Rome hotels, we thought this was a very good deal and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location - nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bella_bambina_7
Reviews.Content: Excellent location; directly across from the main train station. Our room was on the 3rd floor in the back of the building - nice and quiet. Clean. Large bedroom - unusual for European hotels. The breakfast room was beautiful. The only complaint is that the bathtub/shower was hard to step in and out of -- the tub 'floor' is much higher -- have to be very careful stepping in and out. We would definitely stay here again!! Perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: HumphreyM
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was fabulous. The train station and metro are very close. We actually walked to most attractions from the hotel. It is located on a lively street with a lot of restaurants and shopping close by. The room was cleaned every day. Most of the hotel staff spoke English and were all very friendly and helpful. The breakfast provided at the hotel next door could have been better, but it was decent enough.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this just as much the 2nd time around”
Reviews.Author: NY-travelin-guy
Reviews.Content: My family and I had stayed here two years ago on our first trip to Rome and fell in love with the place. The location cannot be beat. Only 500 feet from Termini Station which will take you to all of Italy and equal distance to the Metro (subway) which covers most of Rome. An easy walk to many of Romes attractions. The hotel is an old world (1920's) hotel that has been kept pristine. It is both urban and elegant. The rooms are average to large by European standards and kept quite clean. They share amenities with the attached Meditteraneo hotel next door. They have a first rate breakfast room and great selection of foods every morning with fresh free cappuccino included. On top of the hotel is a delightful roof top lounge that is the perfect way to end a day of touring rome, while sipping wine and taking in the view. Both times, service was excellent. Don't miss this one.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: sc2070
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Atlantico for the first leg of our honeymoon from May 30th through June 6th. We knew that we wouldn't be spending a lot of time in the room in Rome and that we would be doing quite a bit of site seeing so we asked our travel agent for a nice, clean hotel that was close to the train station. The room was very nice, clean, and just a short walk to the train station. The room was a bit small but we expected this and the bathroom was fairly large with a large bathtub. We had a small balcony that was facing Via Cavour below. It was too noisy to leave the balcony door open but when it was closed it was noisy but nothing that was really that distracting. The breakfast was served at the hotel next door and was decent. The eggs were very runny and the coffee was not very good but other than that it was OK. The rooftop restaurant in the sister hotel next door was good. We had coffee and desert one night. The view is unbelievable. I have a few complaints. The maid would come into the room even though we left the do-not-disturb sign on the door. I felt uneasy about napping if she hadn't cleaned the room because I knew that the sign was not respected. Also, we had booked excursions through a travel agency in Rome. Even though we told we did not have an excursion planned for the day the front desk would call and let us know that they were outside waiting for us. After the second time we told the front desk that we had no other excursions planned. I don't think they made a note of this and sure enough we would get a 6:45 or 7 in the morning call telling us that the bus was outside for our Vatican trip. It was minor but slightly annoying. All in all it was a nice stay and met all of our requirements but it certainly did not exceed expectations. Mr. and Mrs. C NJ

Reviews.Title: “Good quality, reasonably priced, central Rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: geraldthewelshman
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the hotel with friends as tourists. Hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. Rooms are reasonably sized and kept clean, serviced daily. Decor is a little dated. Public spaces are small but guests can use the facilities of the adjacent Mediterraneo accessed internally, which is under the same ownership and has ample. Breakfasts, taken in the Med are satisfactory except for awful coffee. Bar staff , in the Mediterraneo are very attentive and drink prices reasonable. Close to Termini for transport and most major tourist attractions are within walking distance. Plenty of restaurants close by. Only drawback is noise. Via Cavour is BUSY and the street facing rooms suffer as a result. We will use this hotel again when we visit Rome, unless .....we win the Lottery!!

Reviews.Title: “3* plus hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jojo9
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend staying at the Hotel Atlantico in Rome. After reading some of the reviews we were a bit doubious, but I have to say that the hotel is actually okay. Its not the 4* as advertised but is more a 3* plus. Although we arrived late at night, this was not a problem for the reception staff who were friendly and accommodating, even when the other half of our party arrived way after midnight. The rooms are slightly dated, but are spacious and clean. We could easily sit four in a twin room for a night cap. The mini-bar is a boon at that time of night and we were not overcharged for anything that we used. Rooms are cleaned daily with a supply of clean towels. Although the rooftop bar/restaurant in the adjoining hotel (Medetearano) was closed for the winter, we did have the use of the bar and lounge area. We did'nt eat in the hotel but can recommend a couple of restaurants in the vinicity: Bell-Roma Pizzeria on the next corner down on the Via Cavour were more than happy to serve us when we arrived at 11.30pm. (Pizza was excellent and very reasonable) L'Europeo (turn right when you come out the hotel and take the 1st right, about 75 yards along the road). Pasta and steak were very good and again very reasonable. Best thing about this hotel is the location. We flew with Ryanair and the hotel is about 3 blocks from were you are dropped off - there really is no need for a taxi unless you have extremely heavy bags. It is also very handy for the Termini Metro, from which you can access lines A & B taking you all over Rome. Would we stay here again? Definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant and Unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: HPower
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in this hotel, and I have to say I was very much impressed. From the moment we arrived to the time we left, the staff were very courteous and helpful. Our room was larger than I would have expected in a Roman hotel, as was the bathroom. Our room came with two mini balconies, one adjoining the main room, one with the bathroom. The staff were patient and friendly in response to our requests, and endeavoured to find us everything from movies in English to suitable restaurants to places to visit. The bar also had a comfortable and friendly atmosphere. It is safe to say that when I return to Rome in the future, I intend to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's a 3-stroke-4!”
Reviews.Author: ryb1974
Reviews.Content: Agree with a lot of the other reviews. It's average-pushing-good. Its pluses are: Rooftop bar / restaurant - nice food, pleasant service, fantastic views. Overall service - very attentive, courteous, polite, will go the extra mile for you. Location - if you need to be near Termini. NB although this area is a bit dodgy overall, the EXACT location of the hotel is fine. Its minuses are: Rooms are rather dated. My own experience of breakfast was disappointing because it was SO crowded, although I think I may have just been unlucky as several coach parties were taking an early sitting. Rip off extras - charging for everything, including ironing (surely a borrowed iron, or even an iron in the room should be provided at this price), but worst of all, parking. €28 a night, AND they scratched my car badly. But overall, I'd just about recommend it, and just about stay again if I needed to be in this district.

Reviews.Title: “Agree- not too bad”
Reviews.Author: AnnieTX123
Reviews.Content: If you're expecting the Ritz Carlton, this isn't the place for you. The rooms were a little eccentric (green curtains, yellow walls, red desk, pink lamp) and a VERY hard bed. BUT, for the price and the location, this place can't be beat. The metro stop and the Termini station are two blocks away. no need for a taxi unless you are a heavy packer! The rooms were extremely clean, and the breakfast was above average. (make sure you ask for cappucino or espresso - no extra charge-- because the coffee on the table sucked.). The concierge and staff were very helpful and gave good directions and restaurant recommendations. There is a nice bar on the rooftop that has excellent views of the city. For a decent place to stay at a decent price and good location - this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Near Roma Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: debkay68
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in August at the Bettoja Atlantico. It was just me and my elderly mother. First of all, this hotel is in an excellent area for tourists arriving by train. It is only two blocks from the station. If you wish to ride the hop on, hop off buses, they leave from directly in front of the train station. So, transportation is not an issue if you stay here. The room we were given (two twin beds) was on the fourth floor facing the street. The room was much larger than I have seen in other European hotels, so I was a bit suprised. It was clean and everything was in order. The bathroom was very clean and featured a tub with shower and a bidet. However, the furnishings are a bit dated. They are in good shape. I guess this is all part of the ambience as this IS an old hotel. Reception was nice and helpful as was the bellhop. The elevator is small, but it is efficient and quite quaint. A nice breakfast is served in the hotel next door (the two hotels are connected). Bacon, scrambled eggs, a variety of pastries, cereal, etc. Not bad at all. Now, the bad things. Remember that I mentioned that we had a room facing the street? It is by far the noisiest hotel room I have EVER stayed in. (and I've stayed in a lot of hotels). It seemed that diesel buses passed by every 10 seconds ALL NIGHT LONG. Maybe this is a usual occurence in the city (I live in a rural area) so this may not bother some people. I just had trouble sleeping because of the noise. The other bad thing is: prepare yourselves for the beggars. They are all over this particular area. There were three beggars outside the hotel the morning that we checked out. One practically outside the hotel's front door, his wife (I guess) was directly across the street and two more (a young lady and a little boy) further up the block. I feel that the businesses and police in this area can do a lot more in keeping the beggars away. This seems to be a problem not only in Rome, but in Florence too. Probably all over Italy. I thought that this hotel was just fine (noise and beggar issues aside). I booked it online the day before we arrived and had no problems. If you don't mind city street noise and people begging for money and you need a hotel that is convienent, this is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ginja
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night after a week in Tuscany. First big plus: 3 minute walk from Termini station. You can't not find this hotel. Booked room only 2 days before in internet cafe through Venere and was all set up for us upon arrival. Always a good start. From walking through the doors into the lobby, the hotel looks classy and for once the hotel pictures off the website actually look like the place you have walked into. Took the tiny (authentic!) lift up to the room and was very surprised at the size of the room. In that it was large! There was the main room with the bed, and 2 armchairs in front of the TV. There was a walk in closet. Long thin bathroom with a bath and great shower. And best of all, (once I worked out how to raise the shutters) there was a balcony area with chairs. View wasn't brilliant but if we had been staying a few days this would have been a perfect area for us to use. The furniture and decor in the room were modern, in good nick and fitted the hotel surroundings nicely.Very comfy bed and well though out lighting. Hotel is linked at the hip through an internal corridor to the Hotel Mediterraneo. This has the 10th floor roof top bar / restaurant. Had 2 very pricey and small cocktails up here but worth it for an amazing view. Just walking down Via Cavour towards the Coloseum takes you past lots of nice looking restaurants. Ate in one opposite the "Gypsy Travel Shop" which when the food eventually arrived was great. Breakfast was great. Turned up a bit near to the half ten finish time which meant we were hurried a bit, but the choice and quality of food was great. Bacon and eggs being my highlight. Left our bags with the front desk at checkout time (12:00) and picked them up at 17:00. Desk staff very corteous and felt safe leaving our bags there. Paid €140 for the night and it was well worth it for the quality, location and service of a 4* hotel in a major city. Will definitely stay here again if we venture back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Little pricey, overall ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We first landed in Rome for our vacation in Italy and stayed in Atlantico for couple of days. We took the Leonardo Express train from the FCO airport. The train stops at Termini station and the hotel is about 200 meters from the station, making the location very convenient. I think the hotel was a bit pricey (about 200 Euros). However, we saved some by not having to take a taxi. Also, they provide great breakfast! The room and bathroom were nice and clean. The staff at reception were not very friendly OR helpful. Rome is a noisy city, especially Termini area. Our room was close to the main street and even then, the noise level was acceptable for us. However, if you prefer pin-drop silence in nights, may be this is not the best place. Rome is not a big city, so you can walk to most of the sites in 30 minutes, although I would suggest buying a ticket for hop on hop off tour bus (company called 110 something had most number of buses. Avoid taking 'Christian tour' bus, they only have 2 buses, so we had to wait almost 40-45 minutes every time we wanted to hop on).

Reviews.Title: “Really impressed!”
Reviews.Author: RRJR
Reviews.Content: We thought this hotel was great! My husband and I virtually fell through the lobby doors at midnight, after the usual battle to get on and off the Terravision bus from Ciampino airport, and it's about 3 blocks from the bus stand. The staff were friendly, the lift is tiny but very reminiscent of a 'grand' era, the room was very clean, the mini-bar was very much appreciated, and the room/bathrooms very big for Rome standards, the breakfast breadrolls soft and fresh! A very welcome stop-over before heading back to the airport to pick up our hire car. Just remember to print off a map of the hotel location before you are dropped off in Rome in the dark!

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean rooms but a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: traveler08020
Reviews.Content: Room and bathroom were spotless, though a little on the small side for a family of 4 (including 2 small children). Breakfast was good and location was fine, especially after we figured out the bus system to get to Pantheon, Piazza Navonna, etc. Main problem was that some noise and vibrations came through the "soundproof" glass. On the other hand, hotel rooms in Rome are often small and noisy. The other problem was that as of last week, hotel now has fee based internet access in the lobby that is run by a separate company - what was supposed to be a 5 euro charge to use the internet came through as a $116 charge on our credit card (our credit card company then cancelled the card - mid trip). Hotel staff was apologetic and put us in touch with the internet company immediately, which said they would fix it. Hopefully, this was a one-time glitch.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: PaulaJM
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for its' close proximity to the major tourist sites of Rome and it did not disappoint. After flying into Fumicino, we easily boarded a train for Rome and the hotel was literally within two minutes walking distance. We were warmly greeted on arrival by Albert, one of the most helpful concierges we have ever encountered in many trips to Italy. We were immediately shown to our room, although we were early for check-in. We had asked for a top floor and were given one. The adjoining hotel has a lovely rooftop bar where we enjoyed a drink overlooking Rome. The hotel breakfast was fabulous; it was a full buffet and was enough to last us until dinner. In a city known for its' pricey food, this was a real treat. The hotel also has free internet access which allowed us to email our children daily which was wonderful. We did not have to locate an outside internet cafe. Our room and bathroom were spotless. We overslept the morning of our Villa Borghese reservation and Albert immediately called and got us a new one. We went to Pompeii for a day and it was easy to just walk up to Termini Station and catch the train to Naples/Pompeii. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: 998R
Reviews.Content: Very near to Termini station; large, clean room but old furniture. Helpful staff. Price payed € 135 for single room (a little bit high). Very, very italian breakfast: lots of confusion, waiters & turists talking loudly, but nice food.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: JSherlock
Reviews.Content: After arriving in Rome to only to find we booked a hotel that was, scary, to say the least we walked into this hotel at around 11:30 at night practically pleading for a room. They gave us a much better rate than what they could have charged us(their partner hotel that was the next door up wanted to charge us a 100 euros more!) and said they whould have a room ready for us first thing in the morning. They even insisted on showing us a room like ours right then and there to ensure we would be comfortable. The room we stayed in was spacious , cool, and clean. The bathroom was a good size and the beds were comfortable. The breakfast in the morning was nice, serving more than just the continental stuff, they had bacon, eggs, fruit and all the rest. There was also a rooftop bar that had a great view of the city, especially at night. By far, one of the most convienent things was the computer with free internet in the lobby. Overall, our three nights at this hotel made our stay in Rome very pleasnt.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Traditionaldog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights beginning May 29th. Our 3rd floor room for three was spacious, clean, and airtight windows kept the noise from the busy street below to a minimum. The bathroom was huge relative to most European hotel bathrooms and had very large and plush towels. The location provided quick and easy access to trains, buses, and the subway and is an easy walk to Santa Maria Maggorie, the National Musuem of Rome and many restaurants of all sizes. We took a taxi back from the Spanish Steps area one night and a taxi back from the Pantheon the next night. Both fares were less than six euros. One of our most pleasant experiences was having late night coffee on the roof top garden restaurant of the sister hotel (connected). Since we had a pretty good idea of our planned activities, I did not have much contact with the staff. They were helpful in storing our luggage while we waited for our afternoon train to Venice and found and returned an item I had left in our room. The free breakfast buffet was excellent. One's taste and expectation in hotels is obviously a subjective measure but I was most pleased with our experience.
